meanings.definition: To divide into separate departments or categories.
meanings.sent1: The teacher decided to departmentalize the students based on their reading levels.
meanings.sent2: It is important for a company to departmentalize its employees to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to departmentalize the ingredients, but ended up mixing them all together.
meanings.sent4: She attempted to departmentalize her thoughts, but they kept overlapping.
meanings.sent5: In order to departmentalize the tasks, she color-coded them for better organization.

meanings.definition: To organize or arrange by department.
meanings.sent1: The manager had to departmentalize the new hires to ensure they were properly trained.
meanings.sent2: The school decided to departmentalize the curriculum to focus on specific subjects.
meanings.sent3: He tried to departmentalize his closet, but everything ended up in a jumble.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to departmentalize her schedule, but found it challenging to stick to each section.
meanings.sent5: To departmentalize the project, they assigned different tasks to each team member.
